Source_Event_IDs.description: All original event IDs (e.g., 'id'). If only one source provides an ID, this array will have a single string.

Event_Name.description: An array of event names (e.g., 'name'). If multiple sources differ, all unique names are retained.

Event_Type.description: An array of event types (e.g., 'dtype.name'). If multiple sources differ, all unique variations are retained.

Event_Code.description: An array of event codes from different sources. If sources differ, all unique codes are retained.

Country.description: An array of country names (e.g., 'countries.name'). If multiple sources differ, all unique names are retained.

Country_Code.description: An array of ISO3 country codes (e.g., 'countries.iso3'). If multiple sources differ, all unique codes are retained.

Date.description: ISO 8601 formatted date-time (e.g., 'disaster_start_date'). If sources differ, you may store one or eventually keep multiple values.

Severity.description: An array of severity indicators (e.g., 'ifrc_severity_level_display'). If multiple sources differ, all unique values are retained.

Population_Affected.description: Number of people affected (e.g., 'num_affected'). A single integer derived from multiple sources if needed.

Comments.description: An array of summaries or comments (e.g., 'summary'). If multiple sources differ, all are retained.
